processed.result:
You are given a set of $n$ chemicals, and $m$ pairs of chemicals that can react with each other.  You want to pour these chemicals into a test tube one by one, in any order.  

The danger of an empty test tube is 1.  Each time you pour a chemical into the test tube, if there are already chemicals in the tube that can react with it, the danger level of the tube is doubled. Otherwise, the danger level stays the same.

What is the maximum possible danger level of the test tube after pouring all the chemicals?

You have a set of items. Each item can react with a specific other item. You must place the items into a container one at a time.  The danger level of the container starts at 1. If you add an item that can react with something already in the container, the danger level doubles. What is the highest possible danger level you can achieve?
